Update: Microsoft's been sending out the following statement from Stefan Weitz, director of Bing: We use multiple signals and approaches in ranking search results. The overarching goal is to do a better job determining the intent of the search so we can provide the most relevant answer to a given query. Opt-in programs like the toolbar help us with clickstream data, one of many input signals we and other search engines use to help rank sites. That's pretty ambiguous, so ZDNet's Mary Jo Foley Google refocuses under Larry Page; Eric Schmidt says Microsoft is bigger competition... "Donny Don Kirshner would take a kid off the street, bring him up to his office in the Brill Building and turn him into Neil Diamond , Carole King , James Taylor , on and on," Jack Wishna said. I haven't spoken to anyone in the music business that Donny hasn't either discovered, promoted, or touched in some way. Don Kirshner was behind " Don Kirshner 's Rock Concert in 1972, and gave national exposure to musicians including Billy Joel and The Police. the Statesman's Laylan Copelin: "State Reps. Tom Craddick and Eddie Rodriguez are a political odd couple united by their legislation that payday lenders say will put them out of business." From the Statesman's Mike Pence Ward: Texans 70 and older would not have to show a photo ID to vote. People without a driver's license could get a free state photo ID card to vote. And people could use their concealed-handgun licenses to vote. Those are among the provisions of a voter ID bill the Gov. Rick Perry Senate approved late Wednesday and sent to the House, where approval also is expected. But both supporters and opponents predicted Thursday that the proposal will be changed some more before it gains final approval.
